articles.title: Microsoft launches native Mac app for Copilot
articles.author: Anna Washenko

articles.title: Help is coming in the AI copyright wars
articles.author: Financial Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence companies must decide how to pay for human-generated content they need to develop their AI systems. They need to find a way to cover the cost of the content they produce themselves. They must find a solution that works for both them and their customers.

articles.title: OpenAI Unveils GPT-4.5 for Paying Users: Expanded Access Coming Next Week

articles.title: 'Just Another Pretty Alameda Sunrise'

articles.author: Eugene Kim
articles.summary: Amazon is cracking down on the use of AI tools in job interviews. Amazon believes AI tools give candidates an unfair advantage and prevent the company from evaluating their "authentic" skills and experiences. AI tools like coding assistants and "teleprompter" apps feed live answers during job interviews, giving a leg up to candidates looking for an edge.

articles.summary: Amazon is cracking down on the use of AI tools in job interviews. The company believes it gives candidates an unfair advantage. In early testing, people found it to be a more natural conversationalist than previous models. The gains are the result of advancements in unsupervised learning. It doesn't solve problems step by step, but it's a step in the right direction.

articles.title: Here's what happened when AI took a Rorschach test
articles.summary: When an AI was given the Rorschach test, it came up with a different answer than the one it had been trained on.
